speaker: HELENA
text_entry: SCENE V. Rousillon. The COUNT's palace.

speaker: HELENA
text_entry: Enter COUNTESS, LAFEU, and Clown

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: No, no, no, your son was misled with a snipt-taffeta

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: fellow there, whose villanous saffron would have

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: made all the unbaked and doughy youth of a nation in

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: his colour: your daughter-in-law had been alive at

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: this hour, and your son here at home, more advanced

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: by the king than by that red-tailed humble-bee I speak of.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: I would I had not known him; it was the death of the

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: most virtuous gentlewoman that ever nature had

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: praise for creating. If she had partaken of my

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: flesh, and cost me the dearest groans of a mother, I

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: could not have owed her a more rooted love.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: 'Twas a good lady, 'twas a good lady: we may pick a

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: thousand salads ere we light on such another herb.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Indeed, sir, she was the sweet marjoram of the

speaker: Clown
text_entry: salad, or rather, the herb of grace.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: They are not herbs, you knave; they are nose-herbs.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: I am no great Nebuchadnezzar, sir; I have not much

speaker: Clown
text_entry: skill in grass.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Whether dost thou profess thyself, a knave or a fool?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: A fool, sir, at a woman's service, and a knave at a man's.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Your distinction?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: I would cozen the man of his wife and do his service.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: So you were a knave at his service, indeed.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: And I would give his wife my bauble, sir, to do her service.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: I will subscribe for thee, thou art both knave and fool.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: At your service.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: No, no, no.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Why, sir, if I cannot serve you, I can serve as

speaker: Clown
text_entry: great a prince as you are.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Who's that? a Frenchman?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Faith, sir, a' has an English name; but his fisnomy

speaker: Clown
text_entry: is more hotter in France than there.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: What prince is that?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: The black prince, sir; alias, the prince of

speaker: Clown
text_entry: darkness; alias, the devil.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Hold thee, there's my purse: I give thee not this

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: to suggest thee from thy master thou talkest of;

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: serve him still.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: I am a woodland fellow, sir, that always loved a

speaker: Clown
text_entry: great fire; and the master I speak of ever keeps a

speaker: Clown
text_entry: good fire. But, sure, he is the prince of the

speaker: Clown
text_entry: world; let his nobility remain in's court. I am for

speaker: Clown
text_entry: the house with the narrow gate, which I take to be

speaker: Clown
text_entry: too little for pomp to enter: some that humble

speaker: Clown
text_entry: themselves may; but the many will be too chill and

speaker: Clown
text_entry: tender, and they'll be for the flowery way that

speaker: Clown
text_entry: leads to the broad gate and the great fire.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Go thy ways, I begin to be aweary of thee; and I

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: tell thee so before, because I would not fall out

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: with thee. Go thy ways: let my horses be well

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: looked to, without any tricks.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: If I put any tricks upon 'em, sir, they shall be

speaker: Clown
text_entry: jades' tricks; which are their own right by the law of nature.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Exit

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: A shrewd knave and an unhappy.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: So he is. My lord that's gone made himself much

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: sport out of him: by his authority he remains here,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: which he thinks is a patent for his sauciness; and,

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: indeed, he has no pace, but runs where he will.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: I like him well; 'tis not amiss. And I was about to

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: tell you, since I heard of the good lady's death and

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: that my lord your son was upon his return home, I

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: moved the king my master to speak in the behalf of

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: my daughter; which, in the minority of them both,

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: his majesty, out of a self-gracious remembrance, did

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: first propose: his highness hath promised me to do

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: it: and, to stop up the displeasure he hath

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: conceived against your son, there is no fitter

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: matter. How does your ladyship like it?

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: With very much content, my lord; and I wish it

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: happily effected.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: His highness comes post from Marseilles, of as able

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: body as when he numbered thirty: he will be here

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: to-morrow, or I am deceived by him that in such

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: intelligence hath seldom failed.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: It rejoices me, that I hope I shall see him ere I

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: die. I have letters that my son will be here

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: to-night: I shall beseech your lordship to remain

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: with me till they meet together.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Madam, I was thinking with what manners I might

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: safely be admitted.

speaker: COUNTESS
text_entry: You need but plead your honourable privilege.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Lady, of that I have made a bold charter; but I

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: thank my God it holds yet.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Re-enter Clown

speaker: Clown
text_entry: O madam, yonder's my lord your son with a patch of

speaker: Clown
text_entry: velvet on's face: whether there be a scar under't

speaker: Clown
text_entry: or no, the velvet knows; but 'tis a goodly patch of

speaker: Clown
text_entry: velvet: his left cheek is a cheek of two pile and a

speaker: Clown
text_entry: half, but his right cheek is worn bare.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: A scar nobly got, or a noble scar, is a good livery

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: of honour; so belike is that.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: But it is your carbonadoed face.

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: Let us go see your son, I pray you: I long to talk

speaker: LAFEU
text_entry: with the young noble soldier.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Faith there's a dozen of 'em, with delicate fine

speaker: Clown
text_entry: hats and most courteous feathers, which bow the head

speaker: Clown
text_entry: and nod at every man.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Exeunt
